alert.note: Alert for Champaign; Clark; Coles; Cumberland; De Witt; Douglas; Edgar; Macon; McLean; Moultrie; Piatt (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 15 at 9:33PM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Coles, southwestern Edgar, northeastern Moultrie, northwestern Clark, Piatt, eastern De Witt, northeastern Cumberland, southeastern McLean, southwestern Champaign, Douglas and northeastern Macon Counties through 1000 PM CDT... At 933 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Weldon to near Charleston. Movement was northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Westfield around 940 PM CDT. Ashmore around 945 PM CDT. Farmer City and Kansas around 950 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Mahomet, Mansfield, Redmon and Lake Of The Woods. This includes the following highways... Interstate 57 between mile markers 192 and 236. Interstate 72 between mile markers 154 and 182. Interstate 74 between mile markers 153 and 176. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CDT for central and east central Illinois.

area.areaDesc: Champaign; Clark; Coles; Cumberland; De Witt; Douglas; Edgar; Macon; McLean; Moultrie; Piatt
